action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: doctor, air, mine, fair, thumb, rose, octopus, olympus, lemon.
Your opponent's team words are: trip, pilot, police, plastic, kiwi, temple, phoenix, ham.
Distractor words are: hook, bugle, robot.
The kill words are: moscow, tick, forest, drop, circle.
action.label: context

action.content:
<think>
Okay, let's see. I need to come up with a single-word clue that relates to some of my team's words: doctor, air, mine, fair, thumb, rose, octopus, olympus, lemon. The clue can't be one of the words in the list or contain parts of them. Also, it has to be semantically related.

First, I should look for common themes or associations among the team words. Let's list them again: doctor, air, mine, fair, thumb, rose, octopus, olympus, lemon. 

Hmm. Doctor could relate to medical terms, but not sure. Air is a element, maybe. Mine could be a noun (like a mine) or a verb (mine something). Fair could mean just or a fairground. Thumb is a body part. Rose is a flower. Octopus is an animal. Olympus is a mountain or a company. Lemon is a fruit or a car.

Looking for connections. Maybe some of these words can be associated with "star"? Wait, doctor... no. Air... maybe not. Mine? Not sure. Fair? Not directly. Thumb? No. Rose? Maybe a star rose? Not sure. Octopus has eight arms, but not sure. Olympus is a mountain, but maybe related to stars? Not really. Lemon? No. Maybe another angle.

What about "fruit"? Lemon is a fruit. Rose? Not a fruit. Octopus
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
